instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
threads.message:
hi this board came in with not charging, solved by replacing <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2.
found out bil connector is bad,but even with KNOWN GOOD bil attached,fan will spin but no boot (blank display),
if i unplug bil it will boot normally. sponge has been removed, bil looks good,
sda scl diode mode is 0.455 and 0.460, sounds good, is it smc issue ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?
Hall sensor is placed there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.4v without bil, with bil connected, its 0v, bil is known good.. , no short too with bil connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
threads.message: Known good logicboard is working correctly with that Bil, u suspect the bil right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bil issue
threads.message:
u may not believe me.. but yesterday the known good bil doesnt work, today it work normally -.-
thanks a lot..
